snippet: The government said it stopped making contributions to a fund that would pay an additional $13 billion in bond debt.
abstract: Puerto Rico's failure to make $58 million bond payment, along with announcement that it has stopped contributing to fund used to pay $13 billion in general obligation bond debt, has raised concerns that it may not pay $370 million payment due in 2016 on its general obligation bonds; failure to make payment could have profound effects on markets because such bonds are usually not allowed to go into default.
lead_paragraph: The government said it stopped making contributions to a fund that would pay an additional $13 billion in bond debt.

headline.main: Puerto Rico Has Another Debt Worry on Horizon
headline.print_headline: Puerto Rico Has Another Debt Worry on Horizon
